intro: Boucerosia europaea, commonly known as the European boucerosia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Boucerosia europaea prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for gardens and naturalized areas.
